description.narrative: National and sub-national partners develop their capacity and systems to reduce risks and vulnerability of targeted young populations to HIV/AIDS, sexual violence and exploitation, which contributes to Hiv Prevention, Hiv â€“ General, Protect, Care And Support Children And Families Affected By Hiv, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Quality and coverage of child protection services and programmes to prevent violence against children are strengthened and supported by national policies and budgets

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National and sub-national partners develop their capacity and systems to reduce risks and vulnerability of targeted youngpopulations to HIV/AIDS, sexual violence and exploitation

description.narrative: 20 national partners are now able to run sustained programmes and tools supporting HIV prevention, care and support. This has successfully resulted in reaching 1,682 vulnerable children and adolescents (CHAD) with prevention and treatment services aiming to reduce their risks and vulnerability to HIV/AIDS, sexual violence and exploitation. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:10/01/2018

title.narrative: of national partners with sustained programmes and tools in place supporting HIV prevention, care and support, targeting at-risk children
of at-risk children provided with HIV and sexual violence prevention, care and support interventions
